priorVersion.title: CDISC SDTM Severity Intensity Scale for Adverse Event Terminology

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66769

self.title: CDISC SDTM Severity Intensity Scale for Adverse Event Terminology

definition: A scale that defines the degree or state of disease existing in a patient as a result of the occurrence of an adverse event. (NCI)
name: Severity/Intensity Scale for Adverse Events
preferredTerm: CDISC SDTM Severity Intensity Scale for Adverse Event Terminology

terms.definition: A type of adverse event that is usually transient and may require only minimal treatment or therapeutic intervention. The event does not generally interfere with usual activities of daily living.

A type of adverse event that is usually alleviated with additional specific therapeutic intervention. The event interferes with usual activities of daily living, causing discomfort but poses no significant or permanent risk of harm to the research participant.
A type of adverse event that interrupts usual activities of daily living, or significantly affects clinical status, or may require intensive therapeutic intervention.
